original_title: Sri Lanka’s stocks edge up in mid day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s stocks edged up in mid day trade on Monday, Colombo Stock Exchange data showed.
All Share Price Index (ASPI) was up 0.61 percent or 56.11 points to 9,313.31, while S&P SL20 was up 1.23 percent or 32.94 points to 2,718.85.
The market generated a revenue of 957 million rupees, the turnover is close to 1 billion rupees which the market is seeing nearly after a week of slow generated turnover.
Top gainers during 1230 hours were Vallibel, Expolanka and Ceylon Tobacco Company.
Market opened at 930 hours this morning and will be closing at 1430 hours. (Colombo/Apr10/2023)
